column3: str

<UIForeground>F201FC</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FD</UIGlow> Quest Sync<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
The savvy stable master's herd is missing an alpaca or two.
/soothe the absconding alpacas.
Speak with the savvy stable master.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, isn't it? I've heard all about your affinity with the alpacas! My cousin works on the ranch at Wachunpelo─he was practically gushing.
As it so happens, I have need of your talents. Some of the herd escaped during the attack on the city the other day. I managed to round most of them up, but we're still two short.
They haven't been seen leaving via the gates, so I think it's safe to assume they're hiding somewhere within the city walls. So, how about it? Can I ask you to round up those last two stragglers?
Thank you! Oh, and I'm sure I don't need to tell you, but despite being trained as mounts, alpacas are easily rattled.

If you come across our stragglers, make sure you <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>soothe<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> them first. Got that? No sudden movements!

The two missing alpacas should be here in the city. Try and find them! And remember to <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>soothe<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> them before you even think of making your approach!
Hrrrmmm! Spatchoo!

In your haste, you find yourself on the receiving end of a glistening gob of alpaca spit. Be sure to <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>soothe<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> the animal before you approach.
Mrrrmm, hrrmmm.
The suitably soothed animal makes its way nonchalantly back to the alpaca stables.
Thank you! The two stragglers arrived safe and sound a little while ago.
A masterful display of alpaca husbandry! No wonder you were asked to play a part in the rite of succession!
<sniff> I recognize that smell! Let me guess, you ignored my advice and got rewarded with a faceful of alpaca spit? I hope you've learned your lesson... That stink'll be with you for a few days yet!
These alpacas are direct descendants of the mounts we Pelupelu presented as a sign of friendship when Tuliyollal was founded.

I'm sure you've heard the tale of Gulool Ja Ja catching a golden alpaca? Well, the creatures we gifted were sired by that shiny beast itself. To say they had quite the pedigree would be a gross undervaluation!

And you can be sure that their legacy survives today: these beasts are fleet of foot and strong of limb, just like their ancestors. If you ever have need of a mount, you could do far worse than a Tuliyollal alpaca!
Right, I should tend to the two that you so kindly brought back. I appreciate all the help!
